title: Drawing, "Wallpaper Design:  Reconciliation of Venus and Psyche", 1815
medium: Graphite, black, white chalk, brush and black ink on brown coated paper mounted to paperboard
signed: Signed in black chalk, lower right of sheet:  Blondel fecit, 1815
inscribed: Inscribed in white, lower margin: RECONCILIATION DE VÉNUS ET DE PSYCHÉ.
provenance: Sale Paris, Prouté, 1980, lot 71; Sale Paris Druout, December 2, 1987, lot 19; Didier Aaron, NYC
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mr. and Mrs. Christian H. Aall and from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Fund
description: Venus and Psyche embracing at center of composition. Cupid leaning on Venus' throne looks on at right foreground.  Three unidentified maidens in right background.  Neoclassical architectural setting includes pavilion with Ionic columns and arcade with Doric columns.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Wallpaper Design:  Reconciliation of Venus and Psyche", 1815.
1815. Graphite, black, white chalk, brush and black ink on brown coated paper mounted to paperboard. Museum purchase through gift of Mr. and Mrs. Christian H. Aall and from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Fund. 1996-57-2.
